body:
Please don't remove it. .becomes is incredibly useful with STI and reducing
the amount of duplicated code. To be able to refer to a STI object as its
parent class without needing to know what it was is very handy. I often
wonder how the change to .becomes was shoved through so fast without proper
consultation, yet this reversion has languished for many many months with
no action.

I distinctly recall the code that I had to change to incorporate this new
logic change was certainly less elegant than the original.



On Wed, Jul 25, 2012 at 12:00 AM, Pete B <
reply@reply.github.com
> wrote:

> @morgoth I was wondering the same thing. I had an issue with this the
> other day and posted to the [core mailing list](
> https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!topic/rubyonrails-core/rwzq0pZ1MOo).
> The feeling I get is that some people use it w/out realizing the side
> effect and others use it for the side effects. If it was up to me, I would
> pull it out like they did with [composed_of](
> https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/14fc8b34521f8354a17e50cd11fa3f809e423592),
> and let people implement it the way they want. I doubt it's used anywhere
> internally, and I don't see how it's even related to
> ActiveRecord::Persistence.
>
